<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc15851_18"></A>ITEM&nbsp;5.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Other Information </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Compensatory Arrangements of Certain Officers
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Employment Agreement, dated May&nbsp;12, 2008, between William M. Sheedy and Visa Inc. </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On May 12, 2008, the Company entered into an employment agreement with William M. Sheedy, pursuant to which Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy agreed to continue to serve as
Global Head of Corporate Strategy and Business Development of the Company for an initial employment period ending on the third anniversary of the effective date, subject to automatic one-year extensions, unless either party gives 90-days notice of
its intention not to renew the employment period. However, in the event that the Company experiences a &#147;change of control&#148; (as defined in the Visa Inc. 2007 Equity Incentive Compensation Plan) during the employment period, the employment
period will then be the longer of the then-remaining employment period or the two-year anniversary of such change of control. The employment period will terminate automatically upon termination of Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy&#146;s employment for any reason.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy will receive an annual base salary not less than $475,000. With respect to each fiscal year
during the employment period, Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy will be eligible to receive an annual incentive payment with a target annual incentive payment opportunity that is no less than 75% of his annual base salary and an annual long-term incentive award with
a target value that is no less than $750,000. Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy&#146;s annual base salary and target incentive payment percentages are subject to review by our compensation committee for increase, but not decrease. Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy is entitled to
employee benefits, fringe benefits and perquisites on a basis no less favorable than those provided to our other executive officers. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy will be entitled to certain severance payments and benefits if his employment is terminated by the Company without &#147;cause&#148; (as defined in the agreement) or by Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy for &#147;good reason&#148; (as defined
in the agreement). Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy may only terminate his employment for good reason if the condition that constitutes good reason occurs during the two years following a change in control. Upon a termination of employment by the Company without
cause or by Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy for good reason, Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy is entitled to receive (i)&nbsp;certain accrued payments and benefits, (ii)&nbsp;a pro-rata annual incentive payment and (iii)&nbsp;a cash payment equal to two times the sum of his annual
base salary and target annual incentive payment. In addition, upon such a termination, Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy and his eligible dependents will be entitled to continued health care benefits for two years following termination of his employment, which will
be provided through a combination of continued coverage under the Company&#146;s plans and cash payments. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With respect to
Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy&#146;s equity-based and cash long-term incentive plan compensation awards, if Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy is not a covered employee within the meaning of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code during the fiscal year in which such a
termination occurs, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">all stock options, restricted stock, restricted stock units and other equity-based compensation awards outstanding as of the date of termination and held by
Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy will vest in full and all restrictions thereon will lapse, and all stock options will remain exercisable for the remainder of their full term; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">80 </FONT></P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">any cash-based long-term incentive awards will vest in full and amounts in respect thereof will be paid on the date the amounts would have otherwise been paid had
he remained employed with the Company. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy is a covered employee (as defined in the agreement) during the
fiscal year in which such a termination occurs, </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">all stock options held by Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy that are outstanding as of the date of termination will vest in full and become immediately exercisable for the remainder
of their term; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">all equity-based compensation awards other than stock options that are outstanding as of the date of termination held by Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy which are not intended to
be &#147;qualified performance-based compensation&#148; within the meaning of Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.162-27(e) will vest in full and all restrictions thereon will lapse; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">all equity-based compensation awards other than stock options held by Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy that are outstanding as of the date of termination which were intended to be
&#147;qualified performance-based compensation&#148; within the meaning of Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.162-27(e) will remain outstanding and continue to vest (or be forfeited) in accordance with the terms of the applicable award agreement;
and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">any cash-based long-term incentive awards which were granted to Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy prior to the effective date will vest in full and amounts in respect of these awards
will be paid to him on the date they would have otherwise been paid if he remained employed with the Company. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To receive
these severance benefits, Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy is required to execute a general release of claims against the Company. The pro-rata incentive payment, lump-sum severance payments and payments in respect of equity-based compensation awards may be delayed
for six months following Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy&#146;s &#147;separation from service&#148; with the Company if necessary to comply with Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;409A, and any delayed cash payments will accrue interest at the then-applicable
federal rate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy is entitled to a tax gross-up payment to make him whole for any excise tax imposed under Internal Revenue
Code Section&nbsp;4999 on change-in-control severance payments or benefits received, unless the value of the payments and benefits does not exceed 110% of the greatest amount that could be paid to him without incurring the excise tax, in which case
the payments and benefits will be reduced below the greatest amount that could be paid to him without incurring the excise tax. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The
Company is required to pay Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy for any legal fees and expenses that he may reasonably incur in connection with any dispute involving the agreement provided that he prevails on any material issue in such dispute. The agreements contain
restrictive covenants, which prohibit Mr.&nbsp;Sheedy from disclosing confidential information obtained while employed by the Company and from soliciting the Company&#146;s employees and customers during his employment period and for the one-year
period following termination of his employment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>I
<A NAME="toc15851_19"></A>TEM&nbsp;6.</B></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibits </B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The list of exhibits required to be filed
as exhibits to this report are listed under the &#147;Exhibit Index,&#148; which is incorporated herein by reference. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">81 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>
<A NAME="toc15851_20"></A>SIGNATURES </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the requirements of Section&nbsp;13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934,
the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, thereunto duly authorized. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:18px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
